alert.note: Alert for Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lee and central Sumter Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elliott, or 8 miles south of Bishopville, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sumter, Mulberry, Woods Bay State Park, Elliott, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Ashwood, Oswego, Brogdon, East Sumter, St. Charles, Shiloh and Wisacky. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 135 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
